There is an ability to keep u-boot as separate partition. And later on, to create additional entry in DTS file.

To create separate u-boot partition image I've been doing next:

The .bif file:

the_ROM_image:
{
[bootloader] /home/zedboard/images/zynq_fsbl.elf
[offset=0x100000,checksum=none,reserve=0x200000,load=0x400000,startup=0x400000] /home/zedboard/images/u-boot.elf
}

Next, I'm running the bootgen as follow:

./petalinux-v2017/tools/hsm/bin/bootgen -arch zynq -image /home/zedboard/images/fsbl.bif -split bin -log trace

It will create follow .bin files:

/home/zedboard/images/fsbl.bin

./u-boot.elf.bin

Next, I'm switching off the zynq board, changing the boot type to JTAG, turning on the zynq board 

and burning both images:

./petalinux-v2017/tools/hsm/bin/program_flash -f /home/zedboard/images/fsbl.bin -fsbl /home/zedboard/images/zynq_fsbl.elf -flash_type qspi_single -blank_check -cable type xilinx_tcf url TCP:localhost:3121

./petalinux-v2017/tools/hsm/bin/program_flash -f ./u-boot.elf.bin -offset 0x100000 -fsbl /home/zedboard/images/zynq_fsbl.elf -flash_type qspi_single -blank_check -cable type xilinx_tcf url TCP:localhost:3121

And, it's works! I can create new u-boot.elf.bin for updated u-boot image and reburn it.

In addition, in case that the DTB will contain new mtd partition for this - I can use flashcp from Linux.
